profile_positions.description:
1.	Driving and supporting Asset Integrity (AI) & Mechanical Integrity Program (MIP) deployment and sustainment within the CSST EMEA through providing enabling systems and collaboration with the Corporate MIP Domain, CSST Group and Regional M&R and PSRM Organizations. 
-	In the scope of the program are the Mechanical Integrity (in service inspections) program, Structural Steel Assessments, FRP inspections, New Equipment Processes and supportive programs developed for Coating and Concrete.
2.	Identifying opportunities to enhance CSST EMEA’s reliability of fixed assets and for providing subject matter expertise in the troubleshooting and defect elimination process, Inspections and Quality Assessments of new and existing equipment.  
3.	Early identification of emerging “License to Operate” issues and central CSST EMEA governance of the AI program. 
4.	Provides support, coaching and training within the region in deploying Cargill’s Asset Integrity Program to ensure continuous improvement in productivity of the company’s physical assets and to enhance the capabilities of the Reliability Excellence community. 
5.	Directly involved in the development and deployment of standards, leading practices and medium-long term plan development in relation to fixed assets within CSST EMEA
6.	Supports, either directly or indirectly through others, fixed asset reliability process assessments.
7.	Ensure that the governance processes are in place and respected.
profile_positions.title: CSST EU Mechanical Asset Lead

profile_positions.description:
At the moment busy with the implementation of a Mechanical Integrity program for all sites. 
Worked for 6 months as Project Manager responsable for implementation of the Maximo 7.5 maintenance and purchasing computer system in all SSE sites, leading the project team and working togher with IBM, PBS, local site teams and central IT.
Responsabilities Starches & Sweeteners Europe Maintenance & Reliability Leader at Cargill:
Consult and educate plants in inventory optimization: reduce (optimize) required inventory levels 
Provide technical support and supervision to the planning and scheduling functions
Implement and manage a suitable planning & scheduling workflow to optimise departmental resources.
Provide a sound M&R input on new plant proposals
Leads the establishing in writing of procedures to standardize and improve work methods. Allows us to work safe, better and more efficiently.
Analyze plant bad actors list with area teams and facilitate solutions. To improve plant reliability, increase plant output and reduces maintenance costs. >>> Continuous improvement!!
profile_positions.title: Starches & Sweeteners Europe Maintenance & Reliability Leader

profile_positions.description: Started 01 March 2011 as European Reliability Excellence Process & Metrics Lead for Cargill. My first deployment was in Krefeld (Germany) and since September 2011 till April 2012 I was deployed in the UK. Deployment sites UK are Cargill Manchester, Brocklebank and Seaforth. Responsible for implementation of all defined steps in the Process & Metrics workplan with the help of local teams. Examples steps: Operator Care, 5 WHY, 5S, Asset Health strategy, Workflow, Precision Maintenance, Reliability Engineering etc. After the UK I  was deployed in Catelmassa Italy from April 2012 till October 2012. Last deployment was in the Cargill GOSCE/CROE sites Gent, Izegem and Antwerp (October 2012 till March 2013
profile_positions.title: European Reliability Excellence Process & Metrics Lead

profile_positions.description: As Maintenance Manager at Cargill Bergen op Zoom and was in this function responsible for the mechanical and E&I departments, planning, stores, automation and the reliability engineering team. Implemented the Cargill Reliability Best Practicesl and was involved into several leading change projects. Participated as Subject Matter Expert into several European Best Practice teams.
profile_positions.title: Maintenance Manager location Bergen op Zoom

profile_positions.description: In this function responsible for the  planning department, stores, reliability engineers and base level projects. Was involved into the construction of the wheat plant in Barby-Germany, developed and introduced a new maintenance organization for our Sung-Yang plant-China and was responsible for the start-up of two new production facilities in Sas van Gent.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Maintenance Manager

profile_positions.description: Started as trainee and became Maintenance Mechanical Superintendent after around 6 months and was responsable for piping, mechanical repairs and mechanical workshop
profile_positions.title: Trainee and Maintenance Mechanical Superintendent
